trans-unit.source: Windows Universal Apps Engagement SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Windows Universal Apps Engagement SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: How to Integrate Azure Mobile Engagement with Windows Universal Apps
trans-unit.target: How to Integrate Azure Mobile Engagement with Windows Universal Apps

trans-unit.source: Windows Universal Apps Engagement SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Windows Universal Apps Engagement SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone Silverlight
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone Silverlight

trans-unit.source: iOS
trans-unit.target: iOS

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: This procedure describes the simplest way to activate Engagement's Analytics and Monitoring functions in your Windows Universal application.
trans-unit.target: This procedure describes the simplest way to activate Engagement's Analytics and Monitoring functions in your Windows Universal application.

trans-unit.source: The following steps are enough to activate the report of logs needed to compute all statistics regarding Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technicals.
trans-unit.target: The following steps are enough to activate the report of logs needed to compute all statistics regarding Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technicals.

trans-unit.source: The report of logs needed to compute other statistics like Events, Errors and Jobs must be done manually using the Engagement API (see [How to use the advanced Mobile Engagement tagging API in your Windows Universal app](mobile-engagement-windows-store-use-engagement-api.md) since these statistics are application dependent.
trans-unit.target: The report of logs needed to compute other statistics like Events, Errors and Jobs must be done manually using the Engagement API (see [How to use the advanced Mobile Engagement tagging API in your Windows Universal app](mobile-engagement-windows-store-use-engagement-api.md) since these statistics are application dependent.

trans-unit.source: Supported versions
trans-unit.target: Supported versions

trans-unit.source: The Mobile Engagement SDK for Windows Universal Apps can only be integrated into Windows Runtime applications targeting :
trans-unit.target: The Mobile Engagement SDK for Windows Universal Apps can only be integrated into Windows Runtime applications targeting :

trans-unit.source: Windows 8
trans-unit.target: Windows 8

trans-unit.source: Windows 8.1
trans-unit.target: Windows 8.1

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8.1
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8.1

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight then refer to the [Windows Phone Silverlight integration procedure](mobile-engagement-windows-phone-integrate-engagement.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight then refer to the [Windows Phone Silverlight integration procedure](mobile-engagement-windows-phone-integrate-engagement.md).

trans-unit.source: Install the Mobile Engagement Universal Apps SDK
trans-unit.target: Install the Mobile Engagement Universal Apps SDK

trans-unit.source: The Mobile Engagement SDK for Windows Universal App is available as a Nuget package called *MicrosoftAzure.MobileEngagement*.
trans-unit.target: The Mobile Engagement SDK for Windows Universal App is available as a Nuget package called *MicrosoftAzure.MobileEngagement*.

trans-unit.source: You can install it from the Visual Studio Nuget Package Manager.
trans-unit.target: You can install it from the Visual Studio Nuget Package Manager.

trans-unit.source: Add the capabilities
trans-unit.target: Add the capabilities

trans-unit.source: The Engagement SDK needs some capabilities of the Windows SDK in order to work properly.
trans-unit.target: The Engagement SDK needs some capabilities of the Windows SDK in order to work properly.

trans-unit.source: Open your `Package.appxmanifest` file and be sure that the following capabilities are declared:
trans-unit.target: Open your `Package.appxmanifest` file and be sure that the following capabilities are declared:

trans-unit.source: Initialize the Engagement SDK
trans-unit.target: Initialize the Engagement SDK

trans-unit.source: Engagement configuration
trans-unit.target: Engagement configuration

trans-unit.source: The Engagement configuration is centralized in the `Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml` file of your project.
trans-unit.target: The Engagement configuration is centralized in the `Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml` file of your project.

trans-unit.source: Edit this file to specify:
trans-unit.target: Edit this file to specify:

trans-unit.source: Your application connection string between tags `<connectionString>` and `<\connectionString>`.
trans-unit.target: Your application connection string between tags `<connectionString>` and `<\connectionString>`.

trans-unit.source: If you want to specify it at runtime instead, you can call the following method before the Engagement agent initialization:
trans-unit.target: If you want to specify it at runtime instead, you can call the following method before the Engagement agent initialization:

trans-unit.source: The connection string for your application is displayed on Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: The connection string for your application is displayed on Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] You don't need to use the conditional compilation symbol `WINDOWS_PHONE_APP` to define different configuration on standalone Windows Runtime Apps as you only have one platform.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] You don't need to use the conditional compilation symbol `WINDOWS_PHONE_APP` to define different configuration on standalone Windows Runtime Apps as you only have one platform.

trans-unit.source: Engagement initialization
trans-unit.target: Engagement initialization

trans-unit.source: When you create a new project, a `App.xaml.cs` file is generated.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new project, a `App.xaml.cs` file is generated.

trans-unit.source: This class inherits from `Application` and contains many important methods.
trans-unit.target: This class inherits from `Application` and contains many important methods.

trans-unit.source: It will also be used to initialize the Engagement SDK.
trans-unit.target: It will also be used to initialize the Engagement SDK.

trans-unit.source: Modify the `App.xaml.cs`:
trans-unit.target: Modify the `App.xaml.cs`:

trans-unit.source: Add to your `using` statements:
trans-unit.target: Add to your `using` statements:

trans-unit.source: Insert `EngagementAgent.Instance.Init` in the `OnLaunched` method:
trans-unit.target: Insert `EngagementAgent.Instance.Init` in the `OnLaunched` method:

trans-unit.source: When your application is launched using a custom scheme, another application or the command line then the `OnActivated` method is called.
trans-unit.target: When your application is launched using a custom scheme, another application or the command line then the `OnActivated` method is called.

trans-unit.source: You also need to initiate the Engagement agent when your app is activated.
trans-unit.target: You also need to initiate the Engagement agent when your app is activated.

trans-unit.source: To do so, override `OnActivated` method:
trans-unit.target: To do so, override `OnActivated` method:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] We strongly discourage you to add the Engagement initialization in another place of your application.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] We strongly discourage you to add the Engagement initialization in another place of your application.

trans-unit.source: Basic reporting
trans-unit.target: Basic reporting

trans-unit.source: Recommended method: overload your `Page` classes
trans-unit.target: Recommended method: overload your `Page` classes

trans-unit.source: In order to activate the report of all the logs required by Engagement to compute Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technical statistics, you can simply make all your `Page` sub-classes inherit from the `EngagementPage` classes.
trans-unit.target: In order to activate the report of all the logs required by Engagement to compute Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technical statistics, you can simply make all your `Page` sub-classes inherit from the `EngagementPage` classes.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of how to do this for a page of your application.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of how to do this for a page of your application.

trans-unit.source: You can do the same thing for all pages of your application.
trans-unit.target: You can do the same thing for all pages of your application.

trans-unit.target: C# Source file

trans-unit.target: Modify your page `.xaml.cs` file:

trans-unit.target: Add to your `using` statements:

trans-unit.target: Replace `Page` with `EngagementPage`:

trans-unit.target: Without Engagement:

trans-unit.source: With Engagement:
trans-unit.target: With Engagement:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If your page overrides the `OnNavigatedTo` method, be sure to call `base.OnNavigatedTo(e)`.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If your page overrides the `OnNavigatedTo` method, be sure to call `base.OnNavigatedTo(e)`.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the activity will not be reported (the `EngagementPage` calls `StartActivity` inside its `OnNavigatedTo` method).
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the activity will not be reported (the `EngagementPage` calls `StartActivity` inside its `OnNavigatedTo` method).

trans-unit.source: Override the default behaviour
trans-unit.target: Override the default behaviour

trans-unit.source: By default, the class name of the page is reported as the activity name, with no extra.
trans-unit.target: By default, the class name of the page is reported as the activity name, with no extra.

trans-unit.source: If the class uses the "Page" suffix, Engagement will also remove it.
trans-unit.target: If the class uses the "Page" suffix, Engagement will also remove it.

trans-unit.source: If you want to override the default behaviour for the name, simply add this to your code:
trans-unit.target: If you want to override the default behaviour for the name, simply add this to your code:

trans-unit.source: If you want to report some extra informations with your activity, you can add this to your code:
trans-unit.target: If you want to report some extra informations with your activity, you can add this to your code:

trans-unit.source: These methods are called from within the `OnNavigatedTo` method of your page.
trans-unit.target: These methods are called from within the `OnNavigatedTo` method of your page.

trans-unit.source: Alternate method: call `StartActivity()` manually
trans-unit.target: Alternate method: call `StartActivity()` manually

trans-unit.source: If you cannot or do not want to overload your `Page` classes, you can instead start your activities by calling `EngagementAgent` methods directly.
trans-unit.target: If you cannot or do not want to overload your `Page` classes, you can instead start your activities by calling `EngagementAgent` methods directly.

trans-unit.source: We recommend to call `StartActivity` inside your `OnNavigatedTo` method of your Page.
trans-unit.target: We recommend to call `StartActivity` inside your `OnNavigatedTo` method of your Page.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Ensure you end your session correctly.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Ensure you end your session correctly.

trans-unit.source: The Windows Universal SDK automatically calls the `EndActivity` method when the application is closed.
trans-unit.target: The Windows Universal SDK automatically calls the `EndActivity` method when the application is closed.

trans-unit.source: Thus, it is **HIGHLY** recommended to call the `StartActivity` method whenever the activity of the user change, and to **NEVER** call the `EndActivity` method, this method sends to Engagement server that current user has leave the application, this will impacts all application logs.
trans-unit.target: Thus, it is **HIGHLY** recommended to call the `StartActivity` method whenever the activity of the user change, and to **NEVER** call the `EndActivity` method, this method sends to Engagement server that current user has leave the application, this will impacts all application logs.

trans-unit.source: Advanced reporting
trans-unit.target: Advanced reporting

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you may want to report application specific events, errors and jobs, to do so, use the others methods found in the `EngagementAgent` class.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you may want to report application specific events, errors and jobs, to do so, use the others methods found in the `EngagementAgent` class.

trans-unit.source: The Engagement API allows to use all of Engagement's advanced capabilities.
trans-unit.target: The Engagement API allows to use all of Engagement's advanced capabilities.

trans-unit.source: For further information, see [How to use the advanced Mobile Engagement tagging API in your Windows Universal app](../mobile-engagement-windows-store-use-engagement-api/).
trans-unit.target: For further information, see [How to use the advanced Mobile Engagement tagging API in your Windows Universal app](../mobile-engagement-windows-store-use-engagement-api/).

trans-unit.source: Advanced configuration
trans-unit.target: Advanced configuration

trans-unit.source: Disable automatic crash reporting
trans-unit.target: Disable automatic crash reporting

trans-unit.source: You can disable the automatic crash reporting feature of Engagement.
trans-unit.target: You can disable the automatic crash reporting feature of Engagement.

trans-unit.source: Then, when an unhandled exception will occur, Engagement won't do anything.
trans-unit.target: Then, when an unhandled exception will occur, Engagement won't do anything.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] If you plan to disable this feature, be aware that when a unhandled crash will occur in your app, Engagement will not send the crash **AND** will not close the session and jobs.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] If you plan to disable this feature, be aware that when a unhandled crash will occur in your app, Engagement will not send the crash **AND** will not close the session and jobs.

trans-unit.source: To disable automatic crash reporting, just customize your configuration depending on the way you declared it:
trans-unit.target: To disable automatic crash reporting, just customize your configuration depending on the way you declared it:

trans-unit.source: From `EngagementConfiguration.xml` file
trans-unit.target: From `EngagementConfiguration.xml` file

trans-unit.source: Set report crash to `false` between `<reportCrash>` and `</reportCrash>` tags.
trans-unit.target: Set report crash to `false` between `<reportCrash>` and `</reportCrash>` tags.

trans-unit.source: From `EngagementConfiguration` object at run time
trans-unit.target: From `EngagementConfiguration` object at run time

trans-unit.source: Set report crash to false using your EngagementConfiguration object.
trans-unit.target: Set report crash to false using your EngagementConfiguration object.

trans-unit.source: Burst mode
trans-unit.target: Burst mode

trans-unit.source: By default, the Engagement service reports logs in real time.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Engagement service reports logs in real time.

trans-unit.source: If your application reports logs very frequently, it is better to buffer the logs and to report them all at once on a regular time base (this is called the “burst mode”).
trans-unit.target: If your application reports logs very frequently, it is better to buffer the logs and to report them all at once on a regular time base (this is called the “burst mode”).

trans-unit.source: To do so, call the method:
trans-unit.target: To do so, call the method:

trans-unit.source: The argument is a value in **milliseconds**.
trans-unit.target: The argument is a value in **milliseconds**.

trans-unit.source: At any time, if you want to reactivate the real-time logging, just call the method without any parameter, or with the 0 value.
trans-unit.target: At any time, if you want to reactivate the real-time logging, just call the method without any parameter, or with the 0 value.

trans-unit.source: The burst mode slightly increase the battery life but has an impact on the Engagement Monitor: all sessions and jobs duration will be rounded to the burst threshold (thus, sessions and jobs shorter than the burst threshold may not be visible).
trans-unit.target: The burst mode slightly increase the battery life but has an impact on the Engagement Monitor: all sessions and jobs duration will be rounded to the burst threshold (thus, sessions and jobs shorter than the burst threshold may not be visible).

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to use a burst threshold no longer than 30000 (30s).
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to use a burst threshold no longer than 30000 (30s).

trans-unit.source: You have to be aware that saved logs are limited to 300 items.
trans-unit.target: You have to be aware that saved logs are limited to 300 items.

trans-unit.source: If sending is too long you can lose some logs.
trans-unit.target: If sending is too long you can lose some logs.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] The burst threshold cannot be configured to a period lesser than 1s.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] The burst threshold cannot be configured to a period lesser than 1s.

trans-unit.source: If you try to do so, the SDK will show a trace with the error and will automatically reset to the default value, i.e., 0s.
trans-unit.target: If you try to do so, the SDK will show a trace with the error and will automatically reset to the default value, i.e., 0s.

trans-unit.source: This will trigger the SDK to report the logs in real-time.
trans-unit.target: This will trigger the SDK to report the logs in real-time.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
